7964 return Post(path, Headers(), params);
7965}
7966
7967inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, size_t content_length,
7968 ContentProvider content_provider,
7969 const std::string &content_type) {
7970 return Post(path, Headers(), content_length, std::move(content_provider),
7971 content_type);
7972}
7973
7974inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path,
7975 ContentProviderWithoutLength content_provider,
7976 const std::string &content_type) {
7977 return Post(path, Headers(), std::move(content_provider), content_type);
7978}
7979
7980inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
7981 size_t content_length,
7982 ContentProvider content_provider,
7983 const std::string &content_type) {
7984 return send_with_content_provider("POST", path, headers, nullptr,
7985 content_length, std::move(content_provider),
7986 nullptr, content_type, nullptr);
7987}
7988
7989inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
7990 ContentProviderWithoutLength content_provider,
7991 const std::string &content_type) {
7992 return send_with_content_provider("POST", path, headers, nullptr, 0, nullptr,
7993 std::move(content_provider), content_type,
7994 nullptr);
7995}
7996
7997inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
7998 const Params &params) {
7999 auto query = detail::params_to_query_str(params);
8000 return Post(path, headers, query, "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
8001}
8002
8003inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8004 const Params &params, Progress progress) {
8005 auto query = detail::params_to_query_str(params);
8006 return Post(path, headers, query, "application/x-www-form-urlencoded",
8007 progress);
8008}
8009
8010inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path,
8011 const MultipartFormDataItems &items) {
8012 return Post(path, Headers(), items);
8013}
8014
8015inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8016 const MultipartFormDataItems &items) {
8017 const auto &boundary = detail::make_multipart_data_boundary();
8018 const auto &content_type =
8019 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8020 const auto &body = detail::serialize_multipart_formdata(items, boundary);
8021 return Post(path, headers, body, content_type);
8022}
8023
8024inline Result ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8025 const MultipartFormDataItems &items,
8026 const std::string &boundary) {
8027 if (!detail::is_multipart_boundary_chars_valid(boundary)) {
8028 return Result{nullptr, Error::UnsupportedMultipartBoundaryChars};
8029 }
8030
8031 const auto &content_type =
8032 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8033 const auto &body = detail::serialize_multipart_formdata(items, boundary);
8034 return Post(path, headers, body, content_type);
8035}
8036
8037inline Result
8038ClientImpl::Post(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8039 const MultipartFormDataItems &items,
8040 const MultipartFormDataProviderItems &provider_items) {
8041 const auto &boundary = detail::make_multipart_data_boundary();
8042 const auto &content_type =
8043 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8044 return send_with_content_provider(
8045 "POST", path, headers, nullptr, 0, nullptr,
8046 get_multipart_content_provider(boundary, items, provider_items),
8047 content_type, nullptr);
8048}
8049

8155inline Result ClientImpl::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8156 const MultipartFormDataItems &items) {

8158 const auto &content_type =
8159 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8160 const auto &body = detail::serialize_multipart_formdata(items, boundary);
8161 return Put(path, headers, body, content_type);
8162}
8163
8164inline Result ClientImpl::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8165 const MultipartFormDataItems &items,
8166 const std::string &boundary) {
8167 if (!detail::is_multipart_boundary_chars_valid(boundary)) {
8168 return Result{nullptr, Error::UnsupportedMultipartBoundaryChars};
8169 }
8170
8171 const auto &content_type =
8172 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8173 const auto &body = detail::serialize_multipart_formdata(items, boundary);
8174 return Put(path, headers, body, content_type);
8175}
8176
8177inline Result
8178ClientImpl::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
8179 const MultipartFormDataItems &items,
8180 const MultipartFormDataProviderItems &provider_items) {
8181 const auto &boundary = detail::make_multipart_data_boundary();
8182 const auto &content_type =
8183 detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
8184 return send_with_content_provider(
8185 "PUT", path, headers, nullptr, 0, nullptr,
8186 get_multipart_content_provider(boundary, items, provider_items),
8187 content_type, nullptr);
8188}

8279inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path) {
8280 return Delete(path, Headers(), std::string(), std::string());
8281}
8282
8283inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8284 const Headers &headers) {
8285 return Delete(path, headers, std::string(), std::string());
8286}
8287
8288inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path, const char *body,
8289 size_t content_length,
8290 const std::string &content_type) {
8291 return Delete(path, Headers(), body, content_length, content_type);
8292}
8293
8294inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path, const char *body,
8295 size_t content_length,
8296 const std::string &content_type,
8297 Progress progress) {
8298 return Delete(path, Headers(), body, content_length, content_type, progress);
8299}
8300
8301inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8302 const Headers &headers, const char *body,
8303 size_t content_length,
8304 const std::string &content_type) {
8305 return Delete(path, headers, body, content_length, content_type, nullptr);
8306}
8307
8308inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8309 const Headers &headers, const char *body,
8310 size_t content_length,
8311 const std::string &content_type,
8312 Progress progress) {
8313 Request req;
8314 req.method = "DELETE";
8315 req.headers = headers;
8316 req.path = path;
8317 req.progress = progress;
8318
8319 if (!content_type.empty()) { req.set_header("Content-Type", content_type); }
8320 req.body.assign(body, content_length);
8321
8322 return send_(std::move(req));
8323}
8324
8325inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8326 const std::string &body,
8327 const std::string &content_type) {
8328 return Delete(path, Headers(), body.data(), body.size(), content_type);
8329}
8330
8331inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8332 const std::string &body,
8333 const std::string &content_type,
8334 Progress progress) {
8335 return Delete(path, Headers(), body.data(), body.size(), content_type,
8336 progress);
8337}
8338
8339inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8340 const Headers &headers,
8341 const std::string &body,
8342 const std::string &content_type) {
8343 return Delete(path, headers, body.data(), body.size(), content_type);
8344}
8345
8346inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
8347 const Headers &headers,
8348 const std::string &body,
8349 const std::string &content_type,
8350 Progress progress) {
8351 return Delete(path, headers, body.data(), body.size(), content_type,
8352 progress);
8353}
8354
8355inline Result ClientImpl::Options(const std::string &path) {
8356 return Options(path, Headers());
8357}
8358
8359inline Result ClientImpl::Options(const std::string &path,
8360 const Headers &headers) {
8361 Request req;
8362 req.method = "OPTIONS";
8363 req.headers = headers;
8364 req.path = path;
8365
8366 return send_(std::move(req));
8367}
8368
8369inline void ClientImpl::stop() {
8370 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(socket_mutex_);
8371
8372 // If there is anything ongoing right now, the ONLY thread-safe thing we can
8373 // do is to shutdown_socket, so that threads using this socket suddenly
8374 // discover they can't read/write any more and error out. Everything else
8375 // (closing the socket, shutting ssl down) is unsafe because these actions are
8376 // not thread-safe.
8377 if (socket_requests_in_flight_ > 0) {
8378 shutdown_socket(socket_);
8379
8380 // Aside from that, we set a flag for the socket to be closed when we're
8381 // done.
8382 socket_should_be_closed_when_request_is_done_ = true;
8383 return;
8384 }
8385
8386 // Otherwise, still holding the mutex, we can shut everything down ourselves
8387 shutdown_ssl(socket_, true);
8388 shutdown_socket(socket_);
8389 close_socket(socket_);
8390}
8391
8392inline std::string ClientImpl::host() const { return host_; }
8393
8394inline int ClientImpl::port() const { return port_; }
8395
8396inline size_t ClientImpl::is_socket_open() const {
8397 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(socket_mutex_);
8398 return socket_.is_open();
8399}
8400
8401inline socket_t ClientImpl::socket() const { return socket_.sock; }
8402
8403inline void ClientImpl::set_connection_timeout(time_t sec, time_t usec) {
8404 connection_timeout_sec_ = sec;
8405 connection_timeout_usec_ = usec;
8406}
8407
8408inline void ClientImpl::set_read_timeout(time_t sec, time_t usec) {
8409 read_timeout_sec_ = sec;
8410 read_timeout_usec_ = usec;
8411}
8412
8413inline void ClientImpl::set_write_timeout(time_t sec, time_t usec) {
8414 write_timeout_sec_ = sec;
8415 write_timeout_usec_ = usec;
8416}
8417
8418inline void ClientImpl::set_basic_auth(const std::string &username,
8419 const std::string &password) {
8420 basic_auth_username_ = username;
8421 basic_auth_password_ = password;
8422}
8423
8424inline void ClientImpl::set_bearer_token_auth(const std::string &token) {
8425 bearer_token_auth_token_ = token;
8426}

8430 const std::string &password) {
8431 digest_auth_username_ = username;
8432 digest_auth_password_ = password;
8433}
8434#endif

8500}
8501
8502inline void ClientImpl::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
8503 if (ca_cert_store && ca_cert_store != ca_cert_store_) {
8504 ca_cert_store_ = ca_cert_store;
8505 }
8506}
8507
8508inline X509_STORE *ClientImpl::create_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert,
8509 std::size_t size) const {
8510 auto mem = BIO_new_mem_buf(ca_cert, static_cast<int>(size));
8511 if (!mem) { return nullptr; }
8512
8513 auto inf = PEM_X509_INFO_read_bio(mem, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr);
8514 if (!inf) {
8515 BIO_free_all(mem);
8516 return nullptr;
8517 }
8518
8519 auto cts = X509_STORE_new();
8520 if (cts) {
8521 for (auto i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(sk_X509_INFO_num(inf)); i++) {
8522 auto itmp = sk_X509_INFO_value(inf, i);
8523 if (!itmp) { continue; }
8524
8525 if (itmp->x509) { X509_STORE_add_cert(cts, itmp->x509); }
8526 if (itmp->crl) { X509_STORE_add_crl(cts, itmp->crl); }
8527 }
8528 }
8529
8530 sk_X509_INFO_pop_free(inf, X509_INFO_free);
8531 BIO_free_all(mem);
8532 return cts;
8533}
8534
8535inline void ClientImpl::enable_server_certificate_verification(bool enabled) {
8536 server_certificate_verification_ = enabled;
8537}
8538#endif
8539
8540inline void ClientImpl::set_logger(Logger logger) {
8541 logger_ = std::move(logger);
8542}
8543
8544/*
8545 * SSL Implementation
8546 */
8547#ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
8548namespace detail {
8549
8550template <typename U, typename V>
8551inline SSL *ssl_new(socket_t sock, SSL_CTX *ctx, std::mutex &ctx_mutex,
8552 U SSL_connect_or_accept, V setup) {
8553 SSL *ssl = nullptr;
8554 {
8555 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
8556 ssl = SSL_new(ctx);
8557 }
8558
8559 if (ssl) {
8560 set_nonblocking(sock, true);
8561 auto bio = BIO_new_socket(static_cast<int>(sock), BIO_NOCLOSE);
8562 BIO_set_nbio(bio, 1);
8563 SSL_set_bio(ssl, bio, bio);
8564
8565 if (!setup(ssl) || SSL_connect_or_accept(ssl) != 1) {
8566 SSL_shutdown(ssl);
8567 {
8568 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
8569 SSL_free(ssl);
8570 }
8571 set_nonblocking(sock, false);
8572 return nullptr;
8573 }
8574 BIO_set_nbio(bio, 0);
8575 set_nonblocking(sock, false);
8576 }
8577
8578 return ssl;
8579}
8580
8581inline void ssl_delete(std::mutex &ctx_mutex, SSL *ssl, socket_t sock,
8582 bool shutdown_gracefully) {
8583 // sometimes we may want to skip this to try to avoid SIGPIPE if we know
8584 // the remote has closed the network connection
8585 // Note that it is not always possible to avoid SIGPIPE, this is merely a
8586 // best-efforts.
8587 if (shutdown_gracefully) {
8588#ifdef _WIN32
8589 SSL_shutdown(ssl);
8590#else
8591 timeval tv;
8592 tv.tv_sec = 1;
8593 tv.tv_usec = 0;
8594 setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO,
8595 reinterpret_cast<const void *>(&tv), sizeof(tv));
8596
8597 auto ret = SSL_shutdown(ssl);
8598 while (ret == 0) {
8599 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(100));
8600 ret = SSL_shutdown(ssl);
8601 }
8602#endif
8603 }
8604
8605 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
8606 SSL_free(ssl);
8607}
8608
8609template <typename U>
8610bool ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(socket_t sock, SSL *ssl,
8611 U ssl_connect_or_accept,
8612 time_t timeout_sec,
8613 time_t timeout_usec) {
8614 auto res = 0;
8615 while ((res = ssl_connect_or_accept(ssl)) != 1) {
8616 auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl, res);
8617 switch (err) {
8618 case SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ:
8619 if (select_read(sock, timeout_sec, timeout_usec) > 0) { continue; }
8620 break;
8621 case SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE:
8622 if (select_write(sock, timeout_sec, timeout_usec) > 0) { continue; }
8623 break;
8624 default: break;
8625 }
8626 return false;
8627 }
8628 return true;
8629}
8630
8631template <typename T>
8632inline bool process_server_socket_ssl(
8633 const std::atomic<socket_t> &svr_sock, SSL *ssl, socket_t sock,
8634 size_t keep_alive_max_count, time_t keep_alive_timeout_sec,
8635 time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
8636 time_t write_timeout_usec, T callback) {
8637 return process_server_socket_core(
8638 svr_sock, sock, keep_alive_max_count, keep_alive_timeout_sec,
8639 [&](bool close_connection, bool &connection_closed) {
8640 SSLSocketStream strm(sock, ssl, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
8641 write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec);
8642 return callback(strm, close_connection, connection_closed);
8643 });
8644}
8645
8646template <typename T>
8647inline bool
8648process_client_socket_ssl(SSL *ssl, socket_t sock, time_t read_timeout_sec,
8649 time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
8650 time_t write_timeout_usec, T callback) {
8651 SSLSocketStream strm(sock, ssl, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
8652 write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec);
8653 return callback(strm);
8654}
8655
8656class SSLInit {
8657public:
8658 SSLInit() {
8659 OPENSSL_init_ssl(
8660 OPENSSL_INIT_LOAD_SSL_STRINGS | OPENSSL_INIT_LOAD_CRYPTO_STRINGS, NULL);
8661 }
8662};
8663
8664// SSL socket stream implementation
8665inline SSLSocketStream::SSLSocketStream(socket_t sock, SSL *ssl,
8666 time_t read_timeout_sec,
8667 time_t read_timeout_usec,
8668 time_t write_timeout_sec,
8669 time_t write_timeout_usec)
8670 : sock_(sock), ssl_(ssl), read_timeout_sec_(read_timeout_sec),
8671 read_timeout_usec_(read_timeout_usec),
8672 write_timeout_sec_(write_timeout_sec),
8673 write_timeout_usec_(write_timeout_usec) {
8674 SSL_clear_mode(ssl, SSL_MODE_AUTO_RETRY);
8675}
8676
8677inline SSLSocketStream::~SSLSocketStream() = default;
8678
8679inline bool SSLSocketStream::is_readable() const {
8680 return detail::select_read(sock_, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_) > 0;
8681}
8682
8683inline bool SSLSocketStream::is_writable() const {
8684 return select_write(sock_, write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_) > 0 &&
8685 is_socket_alive(sock_);
8686}
8687
8688inline ssize_t SSLSocketStream::read(char *ptr, size_t size) {
8689 if (SSL_pending(ssl_) > 0) {
8690 return SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
8691 } else if (is_readable()) {
8692 auto ret = SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
8693 if (ret < 0) {
8694 auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
8695 auto n = 1000;
8696#ifdef _WIN32
8697 while (--n >= 0 && (err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ ||
8698 (err == SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL &&
8699 WSAGetLastError() == WSAETIMEDOUT))) {
8700#else
8701 while (--n >= 0 && err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ) {
8702#endif
8703 if (SSL_pending(ssl_) > 0) {
8704 return SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
8705 } else if (is_readable()) {
8706 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(1));
8707 ret = SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
8708 if (ret >= 0) { return ret; }
8709 err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
8710 } else {
8711 return -1;
8712 }
8713 }
8714 }
8715 return ret;
8716 }
8717 return -1;
8718}
8719
8720inline ssize_t SSLSocketStream::write(const char *ptr, size_t size) {
8721 if (is_writable()) {
8722 auto handle_size = static_cast<int>(
8723 std::min<size_t>(size, (std::numeric_limits<int>::max)()));
8724
8725 auto ret = SSL_write(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(handle_size));
8726 if (ret < 0) {
8727 auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
8728 auto n = 1000;
8729#ifdef _WIN32
8730 while (--n >= 0 && (err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE ||
8731 (err == SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL &&
8732 WSAGetLastError() == WSAETIMEDOUT))) {
8733#else
8734 while (--n >= 0 && err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE) {
8735#endif
8736 if (is_writable()) {
8737 std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(1));
8738 ret = SSL_write(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(handle_size));
8739 if (ret >= 0) { return ret; }
8740 err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
8741 } else {
8742 return -1;
8743 }
8744 }
8745 }
8746 return ret;
8747 }
8748 return -1;
8749}
8750
8751inline void SSLSocketStream::get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
8752 int &port) const {
8753 detail::get_remote_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
8754}
8755
8756inline void SSLSocketStream::get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
8757 int &port) const {
8758 detail::get_local_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
8759}
8760
8761inline socket_t SSLSocketStream::socket() const { return sock_; }
8762
8763static SSLInit sslinit_;
8764
8765} // namespace detail
8766
8767// SSL HTTP server implementation
8768inline SSLServer::SSLServer(const char *cert_path, const char *private_key_path,
8769 const char *client_ca_cert_file_path,
8770 const char *client_ca_cert_dir_path,
8771 const char *private_key_password) {
8772 ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_server_method());
8773
8774 if (ctx_) {
8775 SSL_CTX_set_options(ctx_,
8776 SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION |
8777 SSL_OP_NO_SESSION_RESUMPTION_ON_RENEGOTIATION);
8778
8779 SSL_CTX_set_min_proto_version(ctx_, TLS1_2_VERSION);
8780
8781 if (private_key_password != nullptr && (private_key_password[0] != '\0')) {
8782 SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
8783 ctx_,
8784 reinterpret_cast<void *>(const_cast<char *>(private_key_password)));
8785 }
8786
8787 if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate_chain_file(ctx_, cert_path) != 1 ||
8788 SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx_, private_key_path, SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) !=
8789 1) {
8790 SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
8791 ctx_ = nullptr;
8792 } else if (client_ca_cert_file_path || client_ca_cert_dir_path) {
8793 SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, client_ca_cert_file_path,
8794 client_ca_cert_dir_path);
8795
8796 SSL_CTX_set_verify(
8797 ctx_, SSL_VERIFY_PEER | SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, nullptr);
8798 }
8799 }
8800}
8801
8802inline SSLServer::SSLServer(X509 *cert, EVP_PKEY *private_key,
8803 X509_STORE *client_ca_cert_store) {
8804 ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_server_method());
8805
8806 if (ctx_) {
8807 SSL_CTX_set_options(ctx_,
8808 SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION |
8809 SSL_OP_NO_SESSION_RESUMPTION_ON_RENEGOTIATION);
8810
8811 SSL_CTX_set_min_proto_version(ctx_, TLS1_2_VERSION);
8812
8813 if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, cert) != 1 ||
8814 SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, private_key) != 1) {
8815 SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
8816 ctx_ = nullptr;
8817 } else if (client_ca_cert_store) {
8818 SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, client_ca_cert_store);
8819
8820 SSL_CTX_set_verify(
8821 ctx_, SSL_VERIFY_PEER | SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, nullptr);
8822 }
8823 }
8824}
8825
8826inline SSLServer::SSLServer(
8827 const std::function<bool(SSL_CTX &ssl_ctx)> &setup_ssl_ctx_callback) {
8828 ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_method());
8829 if (ctx_) {
8830 if (!setup_ssl_ctx_callback(*ctx_)) {
8831 SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
8832 ctx_ = nullptr;
8833 }
8834 }
8835}
8836
8837inline SSLServer::~SSLServer() {
8838 if (ctx_) { SSL_CTX_free(ctx_); }
8839}
8840
8841inline bool SSLServer::is_valid() const { return ctx_; }
8842
8843inline SSL_CTX *SSLServer::ssl_context() const { return ctx_; }
8844
8845inline void SSLServer::update_certs(X509 *cert, EVP_PKEY *private_key,
8846 X509_STORE *client_ca_cert_store) {
8847
8848 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex_);
8849
8850 SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, cert);
8851 SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, private_key);
8852
8853 if (client_ca_cert_store != nullptr) {
8854 SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, client_ca_cert_store);
8855 }
8856}
8857
8858inline bool SSLServer::process_and_close_socket(socket_t sock) {
8859 auto ssl = detail::ssl_new(
8860 sock, ctx_, ctx_mutex_,
8861 [&](SSL *ssl2) {
8862 return detail::ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(
8863 sock, ssl2, SSL_accept, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_);
8864 },
8865 [](SSL * /*ssl2*/) { return true; });
8866
8867 auto ret = false;
8868 if (ssl) {
8869 ret = detail::process_server_socket_ssl(
8870 svr_sock_, ssl, sock, keep_alive_max_count_, keep_alive_timeout_sec_,
8871 read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_, write_timeout_sec_,
8872 write_timeout_usec_,
8873 [this, ssl](Stream &strm, bool close_connection,
8874 bool &connection_closed) {
8875 return process_request(strm, close_connection, connection_closed,
8876 [&](Request &req) { req.ssl = ssl; });
8877 });
8878
8879 // Shutdown gracefully if the result seemed successful, non-gracefully if
8880 // the connection appeared to be closed.
8881 const bool shutdown_gracefully = ret;
8882 detail::ssl_delete(ctx_mutex_, ssl, sock, shutdown_gracefully);
8883 }
8884
8885 detail::shutdown_socket(sock);
8886 detail::close_socket(sock);
8887 return ret;
8888}
8889
8890// SSL HTTP client implementation
8891inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host)
8892 : SSLClient(host, 443, std::string(), std::string()) {}
8893
8894inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port)
8895 : SSLClient(host, port, std::string(), std::string()) {}
8896
8897inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port,
8898 const std::string &client_cert_path,
8899 const std::string &client_key_path,
8900 const std::string &private_key_password)
8901 : ClientImpl(host, port, client_cert_path, client_key_path) {
8902 ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_client_method());
8903
8904 detail::split(&host_[0], &host_[host_.size()], '.',
8905 [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
8906 host_components_.emplace_back(b, e);
8907 });
8908
8909 if (!client_cert_path.empty() && !client_key_path.empty()) {
8910 if (!private_key_password.empty()) {
8911 SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
8912 ctx_, reinterpret_cast<void *>(
8913 const_cast<char *>(private_key_password.c_str())));
8914 }
8915
8916 if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate_file(ctx_, client_cert_path.c_str(),
8917 SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) != 1 ||
8918 SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx_, client_key_path.c_str(),
8919 SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) != 1) {
8920 SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
8921 ctx_ = nullptr;
8922 }
8923 }
8924}
8925
8926inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port,
8927 X509 *client_cert, EVP_PKEY *client_key,
8928 const std::string &private_key_password)
8929 : ClientImpl(host, port) {
8930 ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_client_method());
8931
8932 detail::split(&host_[0], &host_[host_.size()], '.',
8933 [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
8934 host_components_.emplace_back(b, e);
8935 });
8936
8937 if (client_cert != nullptr && client_key != nullptr) {
8938 if (!private_key_password.empty()) {
8939 SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
8940 ctx_, reinterpret_cast<void *>(
8941 const_cast<char *>(private_key_password.c_str())));
8942 }
8943
8944 if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, client_cert) != 1 ||
8945 SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, client_key) != 1) {
8946 SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
8947 ctx_ = nullptr;
8948 }
8949 }
8950}
8951
8952inline SSLClient::~SSLClient() {
8953 if (ctx_) { SSL_CTX_free(ctx_); }
8954 // Make sure to shut down SSL since shutdown_ssl will resolve to the
8955 // base function rather than the derived function once we get to the
8956 // base class destructor, and won't free the SSL (causing a leak).
8957 shutdown_ssl_impl(socket_, true);
8958}
8959
8960inline bool SSLClient::is_valid() const { return ctx_; }
8961
8962inline void SSLClient::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
8963 if (ca_cert_store) {
8964 if (ctx_) {
8965 if (SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_) != ca_cert_store) {
8966 // Free memory allocated for old cert and use new store `ca_cert_store`
8967 SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, ca_cert_store);
8968 }
8969 } else {
8970 X509_STORE_free(ca_cert_store);
8971 }
8972 }
8973}
8974
8975inline void SSLClient::load_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert,
8976 std::size_t size) {
8977 set_ca_cert_store(ClientImpl::create_ca_cert_store(ca_cert, size));
8978}
8979
8980inline long SSLClient::get_openssl_verify_result() const {
8981 return verify_result_;
8982}
8983
8984inline SSL_CTX *SSLClient::ssl_context() const { return ctx_; }
8985
8986inline bool SSLClient::create_and_connect_socket(Socket &socket, Error &error) {
8987 return is_valid() && ClientImpl::create_and_connect_socket(socket, error);
8988}
8989
8990// Assumes that socket_mutex_ is locked and that there are no requests in flight
8991inline bool SSLClient::connect_with_proxy(Socket &socket, Response &res,
8992 bool &success, Error &error) {
8993 success = true;
8994 Response proxy_res;
8995 if (!detail::process_client_socket(
8996 socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
8997 write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, [&](Stream &strm) {
8998 Request req2;
8999 req2.method = "CONNECT";
9000 req2.path = host_and_port_;
9001 return process_request(strm, req2, proxy_res, false, error);
9002 })) {
9003 // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are no
9004 // requests in flight
9005 shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
9006 shutdown_socket(socket);
9007 close_socket(socket);
9008 success = false;
9009 return false;
9010 }
9011
9012 if (proxy_res.status == StatusCode::ProxyAuthenticationRequired_407) {
9013 if (!proxy_digest_auth_username_.empty() &&
9014 !proxy_digest_auth_password_.empty()) {
9015 std::map<std::string, std::string> auth;
9016 if (detail::parse_www_authenticate(proxy_res, auth, true)) {
9017 proxy_res = Response();
9018 if (!detail::process_client_socket(
9019 socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
9020 write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, [&](Stream &strm) {
9021 Request req3;
9022 req3.method = "CONNECT";
9023 req3.path = host_and_port_;
9024 req3.headers.insert(detail::make_digest_authentication_header(
9025 req3, auth, 1, detail::random_string(10),
9026 proxy_digest_auth_username_, proxy_digest_auth_password_,
9027 true));
9028 return process_request(strm, req3, proxy_res, false, error);
9029 })) {
9030 // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are
9031 // no requests in flight
9032 shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
9033 shutdown_socket(socket);
9034 close_socket(socket);
9035 success = false;
9036 return false;
9037 }
9038 }
9039 }
9040 }
9041
9042 // If status code is not 200, proxy request is failed.
9043 // Set error to ProxyConnection and return proxy response
9044 // as the response of the request
9045 if (proxy_res.status != StatusCode::OK_200) {
9046 error = Error::ProxyConnection;
9047 res = std::move(proxy_res);
9048 // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are
9049 // no requests in flight
9050 shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
9051 shutdown_socket(socket);
9052 close_socket(socket);
9053 return false;
9054 }
9055
9056 return true;
9057}
9058
9059inline bool SSLClient::load_certs() {
9060 auto ret = true;
9061
9062 std::call_once(initialize_cert_, [&]() {
9063 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex_);
9064 if (!ca_cert_file_path_.empty()) {
9065 if (!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, ca_cert_file_path_.c_str(),
9066 nullptr)) {
9067 ret = false;
9068 }
9069 } else if (!ca_cert_dir_path_.empty()) {
9070 if (!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, nullptr,
9071 ca_cert_dir_path_.c_str())) {
9072 ret = false;
9073 }
9074 } else {
9075 auto loaded = false;
9076#ifdef _WIN32
9077 loaded =
9078 detail::load_system_certs_on_windows(SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_));
9079#elif defined(CPPHTTPLIB_USE_CERTS_FROM_MACOSX_KEYCHAIN) && defined(__APPLE__)
9080#if TARGET_OS_OSX
9081 loaded = detail::load_system_certs_on_macos(SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_));
9082#endif // TARGET_OS_OSX
9083#endif // _WIN32
9084 if (!loaded) { SSL_CTX_set_default_verify_paths(ctx_); }
9085 }
9086 });
9087
9088 return ret;
9089}
9090
9091inline bool SSLClient::initialize_ssl(Socket &socket, Error &error) {
9092 auto ssl = detail::ssl_new(
9093 socket.sock, ctx_, ctx_mutex_,
9094 [&](SSL *ssl2) {
9095 if (server_certificate_verification_) {
9096 if (!load_certs()) {
9097 error = Error::SSLLoadingCerts;
9098 return false;
9099 }
9100 SSL_set_verify(ssl2, SSL_VERIFY_NONE, nullptr);
9101 }
9102
9103 if (!detail::ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(
9104 socket.sock, ssl2, SSL_connect, connection_timeout_sec_,
9105 connection_timeout_usec_)) {
9106 error = Error::SSLConnection;
9107 return false;
9108 }
9109
9110 if (server_certificate_verification_) {
9111 verify_result_ = SSL_get_verify_result(ssl2);
9112
9113 if (verify_result_ != X509_V_OK) {
9114 error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
9115 return false;
9116 }
9117
9118 auto server_cert = SSL_get1_peer_certificate(ssl2);
9119
9120 if (server_cert == nullptr) {
9121 error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
9122 return false;
9123 }
9124
9125 if (!verify_host(server_cert)) {
9126 X509_free(server_cert);
9127 error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
9128 return false;
9129 }
9130 X509_free(server_cert);
9131 }
9132
9133 return true;
9134 },
9135 [&](SSL *ssl2) {
9136#if defined(OPENSSL_IS_BORINGSSL)
9137 SSL_set_tlsext_host_name(ssl2, host_.c_str());
9138#else
9139 // NOTE: Direct call instead of using the OpenSSL macro to suppress
9140 // -Wold-style-cast warning
9141 SSL_ctrl(ssl2, SSL_CTRL_SET_TLSEXT_HOSTNAME, TLSEXT_NAMETYPE_host_name,
9142 static_cast<void *>(const_cast<char *>(host_.c_str())));
9143#endif
9144 return true;
9145 });
9146
9147 if (ssl) {
9148 socket.ssl = ssl;
9149 return true;
9150 }
9151
9152 shutdown_socket(socket);
9153 close_socket(socket);
9154 return false;
9155}
9156
9157inline void SSLClient::shutdown_ssl(Socket &socket, bool shutdown_gracefully) {
9158 shutdown_ssl_impl(socket, shutdown_gracefully);
9159}
9160
9161inline void SSLClient::shutdown_ssl_impl(Socket &socket,
9162 bool shutdown_gracefully) {
9163 if (socket.sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
9164 assert(socket.ssl == nullptr);
9165 return;
9166 }
9167 if (socket.ssl) {
9168 detail::ssl_delete(ctx_mutex_, socket.ssl, socket.sock,
9169 shutdown_gracefully);
9170 socket.ssl = nullptr;
9171 }
9172 assert(socket.ssl == nullptr);
9173}
9174
9175inline bool
9176SSLClient::process_socket(const Socket &socket,
9177 std::function<bool(Stream &strm)> callback) {
9178 assert(socket.ssl);
9179 return detail::process_client_socket_ssl(
9180 socket.ssl, socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
9181 write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, std::move(callback));
9182}
9183
9184inline bool SSLClient::is_ssl() const { return true; }
9185
9186inline bool SSLClient::verify_host(X509 *server_cert) const {
9187 /* Quote from RFC2818 section 3.1 "Server Identity"
9188
9189 If a subjectAltName extension of type dNSName is present, that MUST
9190 be used as the identity. Otherwise, the (most specific) Common Name
9191 field in the Subject field of the certificate MUST be used. Although
9192 the use of the Common Name is existing practice, it is deprecated and
9193 Certification Authorities are encouraged to use the dNSName instead.
9194
9195 Matching is performed using the matching rules specified by
9196 [RFC2459]. If more than one identity of a given type is present in
9197 the certificate (e.g., more than one dNSName name, a match in any one
9198 of the set is considered acceptable.) Names may contain the wildcard
9199 character * which is considered to match any single domain name
9200 component or component fragment. E.g., *.a.com matches foo.a.com but
9201 not bar.foo.a.com. f*.com matches foo.com but not bar.com.
9202
9203 In some cases, the URI is specified as an IP address rather than a
9204 hostname. In this case, the iPAddress subjectAltName must be present
9205 in the certificate and must exactly match the IP in the URI.
9206
9207 */
9208 return verify_host_with_subject_alt_name(server_cert) ||
9209 verify_host_with_common_name(server_cert);
9210}
9211
9212inline bool
9213SSLClient::verify_host_with_subject_alt_name(X509 *server_cert) const {
9214 auto ret = false;
9215
9216 auto type = GEN_DNS;
9217
9218 struct in6_addr addr6 {};
9219 struct in_addr addr {};
9220 size_t addr_len = 0;
9221
9222#ifndef __MINGW32__
9223 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, host_.c_str(), &addr6)) {
9224 type = GEN_IPADD;
9225 addr_len = sizeof(struct in6_addr);
9226 } else if (inet_pton(AF_INET, host_.c_str(), &addr)) {
9227 type = GEN_IPADD;
9228 addr_len = sizeof(struct in_addr);
9229 }
9230#endif
9231
9232 auto alt_names = static_cast<const struct stack_st_GENERAL_NAME *>(
9233 X509_get_ext_d2i(server_cert, NID_subject_alt_name, nullptr, nullptr));
9234
9235 if (alt_names) {
9236 auto dsn_matched = false;
9237 auto ip_matched = false;
9238
9239 auto count = sk_GENERAL_NAME_num(alt_names);
9240
9241 for (decltype(count) i = 0; i < count && !dsn_matched; i++) {
9242 auto val = sk_GENERAL_NAME_value(alt_names, i);
9243 if (val->type == type) {
9244 auto name =
9245 reinterpret_cast<const char *>(ASN1_STRING_get0_data(val->d.ia5));
9246 auto name_len = static_cast<size_t>(ASN1_STRING_length(val->d.ia5));
9247
9248 switch (type) {
9249 case GEN_DNS: dsn_matched = check_host_name(name, name_len); break;
9250
9251 case GEN_IPADD:
9252 if (!memcmp(&addr6, name, addr_len) ||
9253 !memcmp(&addr, name, addr_len)) {
9254 ip_matched = true;
9255 }
9256 break;
9257 }
9258 }
9259 }
9260
9261 if (dsn_matched || ip_matched) { ret = true; }
9262 }
9263
9264 GENERAL_NAMES_free(const_cast<STACK_OF(GENERAL_NAME) *>(
9265 reinterpret_cast<const STACK_OF(GENERAL_NAME) *>(alt_names)));
9266 return ret;
9267}
9268
9269inline bool SSLClient::verify_host_with_common_name(X509 *server_cert) const {
9270 const auto subject_name = X509_get_subject_name(server_cert);
9271
9272 if (subject_name != nullptr) {
9273 char name[BUFSIZ];
9274 auto name_len = X509_NAME_get_text_by_NID(subject_name, NID_commonName,
9275 name, sizeof(name));
9276
9277 if (name_len != -1) {
9278 return check_host_name(name, static_cast<size_t>(name_len));
9279 }
9280 }
9281
9282 return false;
9283}
9284
9285inline bool SSLClient::check_host_name(const char *pattern,
9286 size_t pattern_len) const {
9287 if (host_.size() == pattern_len && host_ == pattern) { return true; }
9288
9289 // Wildcard match
9290 // https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/firefox-3.0/+bug/376484
9291 std::vector<std::string> pattern_components;
9292 detail::split(&pattern[0], &pattern[pattern_len], '.',
9293 [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
9294 pattern_components.emplace_back(b, e);
9295 });
9296
9297 if (host_components_.size() != pattern_components.size()) { return false; }
9298
9299 auto itr = pattern_components.begin();
9300 for (const auto &h : host_components_) {
9301 auto &p = *itr;
9302 if (p != h && p != "*") {
9303 auto partial_match = (p.size() > 0 && p[p.size() - 1] == '*' &&
9304 !p.compare(0, p.size() - 1, h));
9305 if (!partial_match) { return false; }
9306 }
9307 ++itr;
9308 }
9309
9310 return true;
9311}
9312#endif
9313
9314// Universal client implementation
9315inline Client::Client(const std::string &scheme_host_port)
9316 : Client(scheme_host_port, std::string(), std::string()) {}
9317
9318inline Client::Client(const std::string &scheme_host_port,
9319 const std::string &client_cert_path,
9320 const std::string &client_key_path) {
9321 const static std::regex re(
9322 R"((?:([a-z]+):\/\/)?(?:\[([a-fA-F\d:]+)\]|([^:/?#]+))(?::(\d+))?)");
9323
9324 std::smatch m;
9325 if (std::regex_match(scheme_host_port, m, re)) {
9326 auto scheme = m[1].str();
9327
9328#ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
9329 if (!scheme.empty() && (scheme != "http" && scheme != "https")) {
9330#else
9331 if (!scheme.empty() && scheme != "http") {
9332#endif
9333#ifndef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
9334 std::string msg = "'" + scheme + "' scheme is not supported.";
9335 throw std::invalid_argument(msg);
9336#endif
9337 return;
9338 }
9339
9340 auto is_ssl = scheme == "https";
9341
9342 auto host = m[2].str();
9343 if (host.empty()) { host = m[3].str(); }
9344
9345 auto port_str = m[4].str();
9346 auto port = !port_str.empty() ? std::stoi(port_str) : (is_ssl ? 443 : 80);
9347
9348 if (is_ssl) {
9349#ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
9350 cli_ = detail::make_unique<SSLClient>(host, port, client_cert_path,
9351 client_key_path);
9352 is_ssl_ = is_ssl;
9353#endif
9354 } else {
9355 cli_ = detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port, client_cert_path,
9356 client_key_path);
9357 }
9358 } else {
9359 // NOTE: Update TEST(UniversalClientImplTest, Ipv6LiteralAddress)
9360 // if port param below changes.
9361 cli_ = detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(scheme_host_port, 80,
9362 client_cert_path, client_key_path);
9363 }
9364} // namespace detail
9365
9366inline Client::Client(const std::string &host, int port)
9367 : cli_(detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port)) {}
9368
9369inline Client::Client(const std::string &host, int port,
9370 const std::string &client_cert_path,
9371 const std::string &client_key_path)
9372 : cli_(detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port, client_cert_path,
9373 client_key_path)) {}
9374
9375inline Client::~Client() = default;
9376
9377inline bool Client::is_valid() const {
9378 return cli_ != nullptr && cli_->is_valid();
9379}
9380

9703inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path) {
9704 return cli_->Delete(path);
9705}
9706inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers) {
9707 return cli_->Delete(path, headers);
9708}
9709inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const char *body,
9710 size_t content_length,
9711 const std::string &content_type) {
9712 return cli_->Delete(path, body, content_length, content_type);
9713}
9714inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const char *body,
9715 size_t content_length,
9716 const std::string &content_type,
9717 Progress progress) {
9718 return cli_->Delete(path, body, content_length, content_type, progress);
9719}
9720inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9721 const char *body, size_t content_length,
9722 const std::string &content_type) {
9723 return cli_->Delete(path, headers, body, content_length, content_type);
9724}
9725inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9726 const char *body, size_t content_length,
9727 const std::string &content_type,
9728 Progress progress) {
9729 return cli_->Delete(path, headers, body, content_length, content_type,
9730 progress);
9731}
9732inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const std::string &body,
9733 const std::string &content_type) {
9734 return cli_->Delete(path, body, content_type);
9735}
9736inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const std::string &body,
9737 const std::string &content_type,
9738 Progress progress) {
9739 return cli_->Delete(path, body, content_type, progress);
9740}
9741inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9742 const std::string &body,
9743 const std::string &content_type) {
9744 return cli_->Delete(path, headers, body, content_type);
9745}
9746inline Result Client::Delete(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9747 const std::string &body,
9748 const std::string &content_type,
9749 Progress progress) {
9750 return cli_->Delete(path, headers, body, content_type, progress);
9751}
9752inline Result Client::Options(const std::string &path) {
9753 return cli_->Options(path);
9754}
9755inline Result Client::Options(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers) {
9756 return cli_->Options(path, headers);
9757}
9758
9759inline bool Client::send(Request &req, Response &res, Error &error) {
9760 return cli_->send(req, res, error);
9761}
9762
9763inline Result Client::send(const Request &req) { return cli_->send(req); }
9764
9765inline void Client::stop() { cli_->stop(); }
9766
9767inline std::string Client::host() const { return cli_->host(); }
9768
9769inline int Client::port() const { return cli_->port(); }
9770
9771inline size_t Client::is_socket_open() const { return cli_->is_socket_open(); }
9772
9773inline socket_t Client::socket() const { return cli_->socket(); }
9774
9775inline void
9776Client::set_hostname_addr_map(std::map<std::string, std::string> addr_map) {
9777 cli_->set_hostname_addr_map(std::move(addr_map));
9778}
9779
9780inline void Client::set_default_headers(Headers headers) {
9781 cli_->set_default_headers(std::move(headers));
9782}
9783
9784inline void Client::set_header_writer(
9785 std::function<ssize_t(Stream &, Headers &)> const &writer) {
9786 cli_->set_header_writer(writer);
9787}
9788
9789inline void Client::set_address_family(int family) {
9790 cli_->set_address_family(family);
9791}

9794

9796 cli_->set_socket_options(std::move(socket_options));
9797}
9798

9800 cli_->set_connection_timeout(sec, usec);
9801}
9802

9804 cli_->set_read_timeout(sec, usec);
9805}
9806

9808 cli_->set_write_timeout(sec, usec);
9809}

9812 const std::string &password) {
9813 cli_->set_basic_auth(username, password);
9814}

9816 cli_->set_bearer_token_auth(token);
9817}

9820 const std::string &password) {

9822}
9823#endif

9827 cli_->set_follow_location(on);
9828}

9833

9837 cli_->set_interface(intf);
9838}

9840inline void Client::set_proxy(const std::string &host, int port) {
9841 cli_->set_proxy(host, port);
9842}

9844 const std::string &password) {
9845 cli_->set_proxy_basic_auth(username, password);
9846}

9854}
9855#endif
9856
9857#ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
9858inline void Client::enable_server_certificate_verification(bool enabled) {
9859 cli_->enable_server_certificate_verification(enabled);
9860}
9861#endif
9862
9863inline void Client::set_logger(Logger logger) {
9864 cli_->set_logger(std::move(logger));
9865}
9866
9867#ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
9868inline void Client::set_ca_cert_path(const std::string &ca_cert_file_path,
9869 const std::string &ca_cert_dir_path) {
9870 cli_->set_ca_cert_path(ca_cert_file_path, ca_cert_dir_path);
9871}
9872
9873inline void Client::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
9874 if (is_ssl_) {
9875 static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).set_ca_cert_store(ca_cert_store);
9876 } else {
9877 cli_->set_ca_cert_store(ca_cert_store);
9878 }
9879}
9880
9881inline void Client::load_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert, std::size_t size) {
9882 set_ca_cert_store(cli_->create_ca_cert_store(ca_cert, size));
9883}
9884
9885inline long Client::get_openssl_verify_result() const {
9886 if (is_ssl_) {
9887 return static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).get_openssl_verify_result();
9888 }
9889 return -1; // NOTE: -1 doesn't match any of X509_V_ERR_???
9890}
9891
9892inline SSL_CTX *Client::ssl_context() const {
9893 if (is_ssl_) { return static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).ssl_context(); }
9894 return nullptr;
9895}
9896#endif
9897
9898// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9899
9900} // namespace httplib

9903#undef poll
9904#endif
